title: Ticket #6876: Support output file remaps for URLs
description:
On output, we can only specify an "output destination": if set, on the final transfer from the condor_starter, we copy each file in the output sandbox to: 

OutputDestination + "/" + filename

This really means everything -- including stdout and stderr from the job. We believe this has been highly unpopular and that users actually want only specific transfers to go URLs.

For now, I'd like to keep the OutputDestination semantic to preserve backward compatibility - but this might be removable in the future.

Instead, we should use the existing transfer_output_remaps on the upload side. If the output file is to be remapped to a URL, then it should be transferred from the starter using a hook instead of CEDAR. By removing a limit on the existing remap mechanism, we have minimal user interface changes.

In terms of when the hook is invoked, we should keep the existing logic for OutputDestination. This is only invoked when it is a "final transfer" (which is only true for Upload from the starter to the shadow). The hooks should not be invoked when the file transfer output is used by client tools (condor_transfer_data or the Python bindings).

2019-Feb-11 17:16:13 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Patches look good, thanks!

Couple minor issues I noticed are below... most (all?) of these issues existed in this part of the code before these patches

  1. OutputDestination has a DIR_DELIM_CHAR appended; it really should just be a forward character always, since this is URL not a local filesystem path name. ( Now fixed in [56167] )
  2. Memory allocation/deallocation mismatch : Many of the data members in file transfer, include the output destination, are allocated with strdup() (sigh) but then deallocated in the dtor with delete (instead of free). Seems like valgrind should have flagged this error years ago? Maybe in practice the compiler does not care since the data type is char * ?
  3. More comments in the code would always be appreciated
